result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael James Blaschka

records.addlTxt: 3:40 PM Defendant Michael James Blaschka not in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Michael James Blaschka. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court review of case. Magallones does not know Defendant's whereabouts - statement to Defendant's health. Schiek request warrant be authorized.  Schiek/Magallones/Court statement to Jury Trial date. Court will take trial date off - authorizes warrant. adj. 03:43 PM

3:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski  in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael James Blaschka in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Michael James Blaschka. Magallones states received offer and Defendant does not accept - would like to set for 1 day trial. Bond continued. adj. 03:37 PM
Jury trial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael James Blaschka appeared by video. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Michael James Blaschka. Magallones states case is not resolved - has offer - would like to set out. Defendant to appear in person at next appearance. Bond continued. adj. 03:42 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael James Blaschka appeared by video. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Michael James Blaschka. Court states Defendant is having some medical treatment which does not allow him to travel. Magallones would like to set for another pre-trial. Bond continued. adj. 02:33 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
10:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael James Blaschka appeared by video.  Attorney Breanna Magallones appeared by video for Michael James Blaschka. 
Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  
Pfieffer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. 
Bail continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Not go on premises listed in complaint

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael James Blaschka appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones appearing in court. Magallones states Defendant is eligible - will be representing if no conflict. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Court set cash bond over weekend. Court verifies address with Defendant. Magallones would like to set for a preliminary hearing. Court sets bond. adj. 01:39 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
